meanings.definition: A person who wrings their hands in anxiety or distress.
meanings.sent1: The handwringers in the waiting room anxiously twisted their hands while waiting for news.
meanings.sent2: The handwringers at the meeting expressed their worry by constantly wringing their hands.
meanings.sent3: The handwringers at the party were so nervous that they kept fidgeting with their hands.
meanings.sent4: The handwringers in the movie theater were so engrossed in the film that they unconsciously twisted their hands.
meanings.sent5: The image of the handwringers wringing their hands in fear stayed with me long after the play ended.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals who express worry or concern without taking action.
meanings.sent1: The handwringers in the office meeting voiced their concerns but did not propose any solutions.
meanings.sent2: The handwringers in the community meeting were vocal about their worries but did not offer any help.
meanings.sent3: The handwringers in the book club fretted over the ending of the novel without suggesting any alternatives.
meanings.sent4: The handwringers in the classroom were quick to express their fears but hesitant to take any steps forward.
meanings.sent5: The group of handwringers gathered around the issue, but their worries overshadowed any potential solutions.
